page.title: 11BURGHLEY- HORSE TRIALS
page.content: Scattered through the park are many horse jumps used for the Burghley horse trials 3 day event held in September,which is attended by many 1st class riders and is very important.One horse jump we saw was made of logs,wire and rope.There were two of them placed facing each other.A roadway passed between them 4m below. Each jump was 1.5m high.The second one we saw was in the middle of a field.It was tied together by rope and wire.At Burghley every year the horse trials take place.They involve three events: dressage,show jumping and cross country.The dressage is marked on style. The show jumps are about 5 feet high and form a very difficult course.The cross country is great fun.There are 34 jumps.They are very different to the normal jumps you would see.
